title: Anthropic to invest $50 billion to build data centers in US
description: (Reuters) -AI startup Anthropic said on Wednesday it would invest $50 billion in building data centers in the U.S., the latest multi-billion-dollar outlay in the industry as companies race to expand their artificial intelligence infrastructure.
content:

title: Browsers Can Now Do Tasks For You - Here's What Agentic AI Means
description: Artificial Intelligence in your browser can use the web on your behalf, but privacy concerns and security vulnerabilities make it a risky proposition.
content: Since its inception, the functionality of the internet has evolved hugely. However, how we interact with it hasn't. It goes like this — search, scroll, select, take appropriate action — repeat as required. Latterly, AI has started to interrupt this f... [4319 chars]

title: AI detects hidden objects on chest scans better than radiologists
description: Researchers at the University of Southampton have developed an artificial intelligence (AI) tool that can spot hard-to-see objects lodged in patients' airways better than expert radiologists.
content:
Researchers at the University of Southampton have developed an artificial intelligence (AI) tool that can spot hard-to-see objects lodged in patients' airways better than expert radiologists.

title: Why emerging economies are embracing AI
description: MILAN, Italy — During a recent trip to Kazakhstan, I was struck by people’s enthusiasm for artificial intelligence (AI). Virtually everyone I encountered — including academics, policymakers and entrepreneurs — seemed convinced that the technology will help solve thorny challenges, from diversifying the economy away from dependence on natural resources to expanding access to critical services, particularly for remote populations. I had expected the diffusion of knowledge about AI to be slower, but perhaps their positivity should not have surprised me. After all, the rapid development of AI implies important opportunities for emerging economies.

title: Humans can no longer tell AI music from real thing - survey
description: PARIS — It has become nearly impossible for people to tell the difference between music generated by artificial intelligence (AI) and that created by humans, according to a survey released on Wednesday.
content:
PARIS — It has become nearly impossible for people to tell the difference between music generated by artificial intelligence (AI) and that created by humans, according to a survey released on Wednesday.
